intro: Argostemma annamiticum, commonly known as the Annamite argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, elliptical berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
